column4: hey all, I just installed 11.10 on a secondary pc and I'm very new to linux, and I'm having trouble getting my usb wireless adapter to work.  Can anyone give me a hand?
nice, I'm not the only one in this boat!
it says I'm connected but my browser gives me nothing
or it could be a locked down network awaiting yoru entry code...
in a terminal type the following then paste the output    lspci -vvnn | grep 14e4
I didn't get any output
NO output?  NOTHING?
shouldn't need to to do it this way but try this instead sudo lpsci -vvnn | grep 14e4
I still get nothing
copy and paste the following to your terminal  lspci -vvnn | grep 14e4
I'm on my windows machine so I can't copy paste to terminal from here
ok, type in anything after "Broadcom" if that term is present
lubuntu and xubuntu are designed for older or lower spec machines like yours.
it IS officially ubuntu just different flavort
desktop and alternate install the same thing.  alternate is a text based installer to bypass common display issues while installing.
64 if you have > 4gigs of fam
I wouldn't do 12.04 until it's released...
NEW one?  or the same one...
could the connection require a password wep/wap protected?
I have the WPA2 password and SSID entered correctly
easier test; same usb, different wifi point
